column2: Key Apple suppliers seeking stake in Taiwan chip packaging firm TAIPEI
column3: Aug 28 Iphone assembler Hon Hai Precision Industry Co Ltd will buy a 21 percent stake in Siliconware Precision Industries Co Ltd (SPIL)
column5: days after another Taiwan-based Apple Inc supplier also said it wanted to buy into the chip packaging firm. ~

column2: Coach shrinks Hong Kong presence amid drop in China shoppers HONG KONG
column3: Aug 28 Leather goods maker Coach Inc  is shutting one of its three flagship locations in Hong Kong next week
column4: the latest retailer to be hit by the drop in the number of mainland Chinese visitors to the city amid a slowing economy and weaker yuan. ~

column2: Hedge funds that crowded into same names likely to nurse losses BOSTON Hedge fund managers often promise to find stock ideas off the beaten path but this month many prominent players have been bloodied by doing exactly the opposite; betting on a small handful of popular names that sold off sharply in August. ~Hedge funds that crowded into same names likely to nurse losses BOSTON

column2: FedEx pilot union's executive council votes in favor of labor contract FedEx Corp  pilot union's executive council has voted in favor of a tentative contract that seeks better employment terms including higher hourly pay rates and retirement plan enhancement
column3: the Air Line Pilots Association said. ~FedEx pilot union's executive council votes in favor of labor contract Aug 28 FedEx Corp pilot union's executive council has voted in favor of a tentative contract that seeks better employment terms including higher hourly pay rates and retirement plan enhancement

column9: Tyson Foods drop farm after videotape shows animal cruelty LOS ANGELES
column10: Aug 27 McDonald's Corp and Tyson Foods both severed ties on Thursday with a Tennessee farm where workers were seen stabbing
column11: clubbing and stomping on chickens in an undercover video shot by animal rights activists. ~

column2: UPDATE 1-FDA warns of severe joint pain risk with DPP-4 diabetes drugs Aug 28 A class of diabetes drugs that include Merck & Co Inc's Januvia has been linked with severe joint pain

column2: China's Unigroup chairman visiting U.S. to discuss Micron bid-sources WASHINGTON/BEIJING
column3: Aug 28 The chairman of China's Tsinghua Unigroup travelled to the United States this week to meet with board members of Micron Technology and try to revive a politically fraught takeover bid of the U.S. chipmaker
column4: people familiar with the matter said. ~

column2: UPDATE 2-U.S. Int'l Trade Commission clears Microsoft of patent infringement NEW YORK
column3: Aug 28 Microsoft Corp avoided a potentially costly setback to its mobile phone business on Friday as the U.S. International Trade Commission declined to block the import of its devices in a longstanding patent dispute. ~
